the most

places and things and whatever else that made me

couldn't get high so I saw only virtues

find what I need but lose what I wanted the most

little wars won in bigger wars shattered
places and things are easy to speak to
find what I need but lose what I wanted the most

when I came back I left what had made me
find out too late those pieces still chase me
you never do leave the first home that took you
find what you need and lose what you wanted the most

An old recording from a really long time ago, done on a Fostex 4-track cassette. This was a re-recording and substantial retooling of the original version written as a junior in high school in 1989. The title was taken from a Langston Hughes poem called 'Strange Hurt'.


Krister Axel - acoustic guitar, vocals, Korg CX-3

You’re not going to waste it all

APR 10 2007

Illuminate the Sky

link


3:52 minutes (4.42 MB)

notes: standard tuning, capo 2nd fret, verse lives around small chord G formation up two frets - i.e., B chord. Chorus moves to E.


A slight jazz feel, fast tempo yet laid back. Gorgeous French horn / trombone arrangement. Featured on the soundtrack to 'A Colombia' by Ryan Byrne, this is still one of my personal favorites.


Mark Corben on bass

Bill Dowling did the horn charts
